comments.body: This is a great idea, but instead of having the necklace in the chestplate slot why not have it in a new accessory slot? Maybe accessories could be added and certain accessories give certain effects like your Amethyst Necklace concept; other accessories could be like rings and bracelets made from various ores and given effects with potions, or other objects, through the Smithing Table.

What if there were specific cave noises for each cave biome, not just the lush caves? That way the lush caves, dripstone caves, and deep dark would all have unique sounds that could help locate them underground.
Too overpowered, it cuts the smelting time in ninths.
Hang on listen if you make it slower to smelt the blocks to equally the amount of 9 ores but very slightly or no differed it would make it even again please consider this
Hi Minecraft, About that, if the raw iron, smelted to iron ingot, how about the raw blocks smelted to blocks, like raw iron block, smelted to iron block
That's a good idea but how play 1.17 now ?
It does have a weakness: its blind. It doesn't make sense for it to have additional weaknesses anyways since you're not supposed to fight it.
No never
I know you should not fight him, but you could for example, mess around with wardens in creative mode.
even if this was added it wouldn't affect anything since the warden lives deep underground where sunlight can't get in anyway.

No...bc i want to see the warden in daylight and i cant do that if it burns

Plus it wouldn't be fun

No...bc i want to see the warden in daylight and i cant do that if it burns

Plus it wouldn't be fun also the warden is a different mob they literally said it
then whats point of being powerful mob this would make it too easy to kill warden

Voted. Gold is the only ore that can't have its raw block forms naturally generating, and the nether is a great way to do it. By veins I assume you mean blobs, but it would also be cool if there were rare, much smaller ore veins in the nether--this would further incentivise nether mining.
Raw gold should also generate in mesa biomes.
I like 399265256131's idea better.
Do you mean the nether gold ore blobs?
I don't think there needs to be a new block.

No crafting recipe for the brush. Niche materials for an item with low durability and niche uses. Crafting is meant to be essential part of the game, not to create random little things that are used twice and ignored. Give them the villagers. Trade for the brush. Make the brush feel exclusive. Add lore to the villagers.
This mob is very interesting and looks very interesting.

I like this idea! I don't know about the taming mechanics, but it would be cool to have color variation in underground slimes. Also, it will differentiate slimes from the swamps and slimes from the underground
What if these slimes had some attraction towards ores to help the player find their way in dark caves.
Thanks for the positive comments guys! And I like the idea of using slimes to guide the Player underground.
I feel like as If this could work, because when you think about it, while wolves do exist, Variety and convenience is due and it would be very fitting if slimes got an Update.
I agree
Just how hard is it to mine? Like mining obsidian? Or the difference between stone and an ore? I'm on Xbox, so the caves themselves have not been added in yet.

What I mean by this post is that mojang should provide a good reason to get netherite, because diamond tools can instamine stone with a beacon, so there isn't that much use for a netherite pickaxe.  Deepslate is twice as hard to mine as stone, so maybe they should make netherite pickaxes a little bit faster.
Yes, I always just keep my diamond tools because there's not much of a reason for me to go get netherite
No. Diamonds are meant to be rare.

No, diamonds are only rare because of how deep they generate. They should be in between uncommon and rare for a change. This has my vote. Maybe this update should introduce diamond ore caves too! I have enough trouble finding diamonds on my world as it is. I. WANT. MORE!
Diamonds should spawn on trees too why not

I believe that the smaller veins are beneficial in the long run. Instead of spikes and valleys of excitement in terms of Diamond location, the distribution of Diamond Discovery is more even. However, I do agree that Bigger Veins should appear from time to time as an Uncommon Find. Diamond just probably needs some more utility.

Smaller but more frequent veins smoothen out progression and make exploration a lot more rewarding. I don't agree at all about the excitement of finding Diamonds being hurt by finding less per vein; they're still just as rewarding to find. Smaller veins also force you to interact more with the game, IMO. Previously, progression would spike sporradically, and it was way easier to call it quits when exploring a cavern because you had gotten what you needed. Building mining infrastructure and strips will be a lot more interesting in the update than prior, too, especially with underground builds and biomes!

The only reason we might feel a bit let down now is because we still have that learned experience of there being a bunch per vein. We expect more right now, but that expectation will be unlearned with time. In the long run, the 21w11a approach will be beneficial.

I could potentially see bigger veins appearing VERY rarely in the Deep Dark, or low underground below Y = -32, but there really shouldn't be more Diamond than there is now. It's only useful for progression and should be limited as such.

I agree with this post: rarer, larger veins are much more exciting than a constant supply of smaller veins. Most ores generate in constant supplies, so having an ore that actually surprises you would be pretty nice.

It doesn't make Any Sense, why you would Decrease the amount of diamonds per vain & chunk till it's lower than 1.16 amounts, if you want to encourage diamond mining & not alternative ways in a cave update? Unless you nerf other ways too, but we already have Netherite that needs diamonds anyways, & mining diamonds was so rare & boring before it's a main reason why people hated it in the 1st place. It needs to be engaging, exciting & rewarding. If not increasing the normal diamond veins, at least make it so the rare large ore variants they confirmed will add can contain up to 10-12 diamonds. Remember that the large ore variants would be very, very rare, especially diamonds, so you wouldn't ever normally find that many per vein. Some people saying diamonds were too common in previous snapshots were probably in spectator mode. Solely Survival won't be that easy.
Yes this needs to happen, just make something like 1 in every 4 or 5 be a vain of 6,7, or 8 diamond ore and then keep the smaller more common veins along side them, that way everyone is happy.
I think there should be large diamond veins, but diamonds should occur less often as a whole. It will make mining more fun and also keep it balanced.

You all are having a very interesting discussion, though 0 of you bothered to check Diamond generation on the Wiki. Let me blow your mind. As of 21w13a, Diamond Ore blobs attempt to generate in 2 batches. One batch attempts to generate 6 times per chunk with 0-5 Diamond Ores (50% reduced air exposure). Now here comes the fun bit. The second batch attempts to generate 1/9 times per chunk with 0-23 Diamond Ores!!! (70% reduced air exposure). The developers just are absolutely rocking it with ore generation. I hope this absolutely clears any complaints. Diamonds have been absolutely de-valued since the Middle Ages of Minecraft, so they might as well make mining the most amusing and fun way to do it, as well as very efficient (just imagine the jackpot you can find if you keep exploring!). They are still quite rare, but with how the game has evolved, they definitely shouldn't be as scarce underground, otherwise why mine for them?

I 100% agree with this. I've been playing in survival and have found that diamond veins are only slightly easier to find than in 1.17. However, the veins are now about 1-4 ore instead of 3-8 ore. I think the amount of ore found in a vein should increase the further down you go, which would incentivize exploring further down and taking more risks.
I completely agree. Finding one diamond was already do annoying before the update, and they made it worse. Its almost like they want us to use villager method to obtain them
I think this would just limit the use of azealia bushes
Bees attack Bears.
Gonna be perfect for caves n cliffs update they should spawn in caves connected to cliffs

I think it should be an item used on the offhand and maybe it could also be used in a way to repair tools that have mending by either directly transferring experience in exchange for its own durability or just make  the effect of mending more XP allot more efficient in general
What if different horns have a different radius from other horns? Or different signal strength from other horns?

Additionally, new wax blocks could also appear there.
Wax could be obtained by burning a honeycomb in an furnace. With its help, candles, waxed copper blocks, and blocks of wax would be created.
Additionally, the wax could fall out after destroying the Bee Nest without the Silk Touch enchant.

THIS IS AWESOME!

Great for decoration and super duper fun and unique! Players would LOVE THIS!!!!!!
magma blocks could spawn naturally below Y=-50
There is actually proof that the stones might work like that on a twitter post from one of the devs.
That was strata, not strands. Strata doesn't turn in random directions because it's flat.

This would be awesome, coz current generation is rather lacklustre and feels on an inappropriately small scale compared to the how everything in the world generates. 

Related threads: (the first two have absolutely awesome suggestions)

https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360077186452-Geological-structures-to-improve-diorite-and-granite-generation 

https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360077123792-Different-Andesite-Diorite-and-Granite-generation 

https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360077125672-Stone-Varieties-Generate-in-Strata 

https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360076970432-better-diorite-granite-and-andesite-generation

How about they generate in intrusive igneous structures?

There are four basic types of these:

Dikes, or vertical "walls" of cooled lava, that cut across strata

Sills, or horizontal "Sheets" that are injected between strata\

Laccoliths, or big blobs

Batholiths, or *really* big blobs (In fact, batholiths are generally so big that sometimes they get lifted up, and exposed to make a mountain range- so batholith mountains would be a fantastic addition for the "Cliffs" part of Caves & Cliffs.

I really dont know why they insist on the blobs. They make cave builds tedious to fix and are ugly. We could have andesite caves or Cliffs of Dover type cliffs and hills, granite/dripstone chambers. I would even prefer stratified layers, it would give an immersive feel of geological processes and look more uniform. Its not exactly a valuable block so I dont see the issue of having more of it available.
I doubt this will ever happen. If it does I wish it is a combination of iron and copper to make bronze and use bronze to make tools. Could use an anvil to do this.
This is like an overworld version of the soulsand valley. Very dangerous, but better materials generate here. I like it.

I like the general idea, only problem is that it seems to just be a combination of already existent items. It's definitely okay to use some like the basalt and that, but there should be some new blocks that fit in here. New mobs should certainly spawn here. Maybe magma cubes, but that's about it. I really like the idea of the cliffs and waterfalls. It could be mainly small "islands" in the middle of the lava lakes, the cliffs, and the waterfalls. Keep up good ideas like this!
Nice post but I really am a bit mad on minecraft for not ADDING ANY COMUNITY IDEA BIOMES! please make a post about asking minecraft to host a mincon vote for adding a new biome.

Not sure socks would fit in the game, but what would be cool is if different types of armor made louder vibrations, like for example, Iron and Chainmail would make more vibrations than leather or diamond.
It would be cool if you would combine armor types with socks, with the fletching table
Wow! 5 votes! Cannot believe 5 people like this idea!

yes, i was thinking about it, a little retexturing with the new 1.17 and htey could add it, ot they could put it like a world option, like superflat and only caves. i think it deserve it place because it was the main goal of many player and now its just... gone
I miss the farmlands hope to bring it back!
Maybe the cave merchant could have special rare items that can only be bought from them, like bells or the Globe banner design.
It's a very interesting idea. With this update, the cave has been significantly improved, and I think it's possible that it will be implemented.
Ok this actually doesnt seem bad I was going to request a cave village. (You can still find my post) So maybe there can be to villages connecting mine and yours ideas?
Really good ideas.
I love the idea of dry ice. It could give off smoke when above land and bubbles when under water
Dry Ice could make mobs immovable for a time when they touch it. Or, it could just really slow them down. It could make things sticl to it like a honey block
Dry Ice could also be used to make carbonated drinks, which could just be a food item or a new type of potion

We need powdered ice as well so it slows entities and players and you also sink into it even if you wear leather boots! We need penguins to spawn here! This is the coldest biome in Minecraft! if players or mobs are here for too long, they would eventually take damage and die because it is that cold here! the only way to survive is to drink a heat potion that prevents players from being damaged by cold.
Mountains with water following down from it
maybe their could be a biome similar to the holwing peaks biome from minecraft dungeons with the trees and red grass from those levels
Please make sure that the Azalea trees have a new wood type inside them and they should have a unique shape.
This was once a thing in 1.12
I agree since I don't like caves and cliffs but I also don't want to crack older versions of the game..
You might want to go into a little more detail, but it's an interesting idea

Lava filled caves would be so cool! But maybe make it so the lava has a maximum depth of maybe 5 blocks, so that huge swaths of cave aren't inaccessible because it's filled with lava. It would be amazing with the new grimstone.
